From: Daniel Dickinson <cshore@wightman.ca>
To: Debian Bug Tracking System <submit@bugs.debian.org>
Subject: rhythmbox: Rhythmbox must be launch twice to launch it
Message-ID: <20080217214045.32760.34836.reportbug@brennin.fionavar.dd>
X-Mailer: reportbug 3.39
Date: Sun, 17 Feb 2008 16:40:45 -0500
Delivered-To: submit@bugs.debian.org

Package: rhythmbox
Version: 0.10.1-1+b3
Severity: normal


The first time (for a session) trying to launch rhythmbox fails and it must be launched a second time before it actually comes up.  This problem is also present in Ubuntu Gutsy on several machines I have worked on.  

-- System Information:
Debian Release: lenny/sid
  APT prefers testing
  APT policy: (500, 'testing'), (500, 'stable')
Architecture: i386 (i686)

Kernel: Linux 2.6.23-1-686 (SMP w/1 CPU core)
Locale: LANG=en_CA.UTF-8, LC_CTYPE=en_CA.UTF-8 (charmap=UTF-8)
Shell: /bin/sh linked to /bin/bash

On Wed, 16 Apr 2008 18:34:09 +0200

> > The first time (for a session) trying to launch rhythmbox fails and

> > problem is also present in Ubuntu Gutsy on several machines I have
> > worked on. =20

>=20

>=20

> rhythmbox in debug mode by using the "-d" option.
>=20

something to do with the panel applet, but I have also upgraded.
